Objective_Title: Strengthen & Protect Western Hemisphere Partnership Network
OAI_Description: Design, stand up, and operate the WHEMCOM Joint Intelligence Fusion Cell with multinational participation.
Land: Multinational land/HUMINT fusion cells at JIFC-HEM.
Sea: Maritime intel desk fusing JIATF-S, Op CARIBBE, and partner navies.
Air: Air ISR and air defense tracks integrated into COP.
Cyber: Core intel networks, access control, and cross-domain solutions.
Space: Integration of space-based ISR and commercial imagery into the fused picture.
Decision_Point_1_Label: DP1 – Core Partners Willing To Share After UK/Colombia Withholding
Decision_Point_2_Label: DP2 – Partner Intel Caveats Acceptable or Not
Decisive_Point_2_Label: DecP2 – JIFC-HEM Becomes Primary Regional Targeting Node
Branch_Notes: If UK/Colombia-type intel withholding spreads at DP1/DP2, branch to heavier U.S.-only fusion with limited partner lanes and adjust expectations for OBJ 2/3 effects.

Objective_Title: Strengthen & Protect Western Hemisphere Partnership Network
OAI_Description: Conduct recurring bilateral and multilateral intel planning workshops to build a common threat picture and update sharing protocols.
Land: Land-focused threat mapping (TCO routes, safe havens).
Sea: Maritime route mapping and pattern-of-life around Venezuela and Caribbean.
Air: Air threat picture (military, charter, illicit air).
Cyber: Cyber threat picture and intel-sharing formats.
Space: Use of space and commercial imagery to anchor shared situational awareness.
Decision_Point_1_Label: DP1 – Workshops Reveal True Willingness To Share
Decision_Point_2_Label: DP2 – Adjust Inner/Outer Circle of Intel Partners
Decisive_Point_1_Label: DecP1 – Shared Regional Threat Picture Endorsed by Core Partners
Depends_On: If key partners consistently sanitize intel or refuse to attend, branch to tiered intel network (inner ring vs outer ring) and accept uneven coverage, especially around Venezuela.

Objective_Title: Strengthen & Protect Western Hemisphere Partnership Network
OAI_Description: Design and field secure comms and data-sharing platforms among WHEMCOM and partner intel nodes.
Land: Hardened land HQ connections and intel cells.
Sea: Secure naval and coast guard ops centers and JIATF-S links.
Air: Secure air C2 and ISR nodes connected to COP.
Cyber: Encrypted networks; identity and access management; zero-trust concepts.
Space: SATCOM and space links for beyond-line-of-sight data-sharing.
Decision_Point_2_Label: DP2 – Partner Uptake and Coverage Review
Decisive_Point_1_Label: DecP1 – Core Secure Grid Online for Venezuela/Caribbean
Depends_On: If high-cost/complexity or political objections block deployment in key partners, branch to reduced mesh with heavier reliance on U.S. nodes and commercial solutions.

Objective_Title: Strengthen & Protect Western Hemisphere Partnership Network
OAI_Description: Run recurring hemispheric JAG and MoD legal conferences to map authorities and gaps.
Land: Clarify land/DSCA/SOF legal frameworks for partners.
Sea: Clarify maritime interdiction, boat strikes, and hot pursuit.
Air: Clarify air policing, intercept, and overflight rules.
Cyber: Clarify cybercrime, data-sharing, and evidence standards.
Space: Clarify legal uses of space ISR and imagery sharing.
Decision_Point_1_Label: DP1 – Consensus on Boat Strike Legitimacy and Constraints
Decisive_Point_1_Label: DecP1 – Hemispheric Legal Map Completed and Accepted by Core States
Depends_On: If partners reject lethal maritime authorities in principle, branch to more constrained ROE in OBJ 2/3 and rely more heavily on non-kinetic tools (finance, cyber, law enforcement).

Objective_Title: Strengthen & Protect Western Hemisphere Partnership Network
OAI_Description: Negotiate and implement SOFAs and intel-sharing agreements with priority partners.
Land: Land SOFAs and legal protections for advisors, SFA, and presence.
Sea: Maritime agreements covering VBSS, interdiction; clarify lethal force norms amidst ongoing boat strikes.
Air: Air basing, overflight, and refuel agreements.
Cyber: Provisions for digital evidence, cyber intel, and privacy.
Space: Provisions for tasking and using space-based ISR for regional threats.
Decision_Point_1_Label: DP1 – Legal Redlines on Regime-Change and Lethal Maritime Authorities Identified
Decision_Point_2_Label: DP2 – Core Partner Set for Full SOFAs Locked
Decision_Point_3_Label: DP3 – Venezuelan Crisis Test of Agreements
Decisive_Point_1_Label: DecP1 – Core SOFAs and Intel Treaties in Force
Decisive_Point_2_Label: DecP2 – Framework Holds During Real-World Venezuela Event
Depends_On: If UK/Colombia-style legal concerns harden at DP1/DP2, branch to tiered legal architecture where some partners retain only non-lethal or non-operational roles in maritime actions near Venezuela.

Objective_Title: Strengthen & Protect Western Hemisphere Partnership Network
OAI_Description: Provide LNOs and planning support to OAS/IADB security and HA/DR initiatives.
Land: Embed planners in OAS/IADB land security/HA/DR work.
Sea: Support maritime security initiatives and norms-setting.
Air: Support air interoperability and regional exercise planning.
Cyber: Link cyber CERT/cooperation with OAS/IADB channels.
Space: Use space products for shared assessments and early warning.
Decision_Point_1_Label: DP1 – OAS/IADB Relevance to Venezuela Crisis Confirmed or Not
Decisive_Point_1_Label: DecP1 – OAS/IADB Recognized as Key Legitimacy Forum for Actions Near Venezuela
Depends_On: If OAS/IADB remain deadlocked or politicized, branch to coalitions of the willing and ad hoc groups for legitimacy and messaging around Venezuela operations.

Objective_Title: Strengthen & Protect Western Hemisphere Partnership Network
OAI_Description: Design and execute IO campaigns highlighting collective security, legal restraint, and humanitarian focus.
Land: Use KLEs and land-focused engagements to reinforce narratives.
Sea: Show joint maritime interdiction as law-based; manage perceptions of lethal boat strikes.
Air: Show airlift/ISR as transparent, humanitarian, and defensive.
Cyber: Conduct cyber/MISO to counter malign narratives about regime change.
Space: Use unclassified space imagery to support public messaging.
Decision_Point_1_Label: DP1 – Narrative on Maritime Lethal Actions Acceptable or Backfiring
Decision_Point_2_Label: DP2 – Partner Sensitivities to Regime-Change Framing Identified
Decisive_Point_1_Label: DecP1 – Coalition Narrative Dominates in Regional Media
Depends_On: If lethal boat strikes generate significant backlash, branch to stronger emphasis on law enforcement narrative and de-emphasize kinetic aspects in IO products.

Objective_Title: Strengthen & Protect Western Hemisphere Partnership Network
OAI_Description: Conduct persistent SFA-B missions focused on C-TCO, border security, cyber defense, and C-UAS.
Land: Train land units in C-TCO, border control, and force protection.
Sea: Train navies/coast guards in interdiction; leverage Op CARIBBE and similar operations as practical venues.
Air: Train air forces on ISR integration, C-UAS, and air policing near Venezuela.
Cyber: Provide cyber range events and network defense training.
Space: Integrate use of commercial/space ISR in partner target development.
Decision_Point_1_Label: DP1 – Vetting and HR Concerns on Partner Units
Decision_Point_2_Label: DP2 – Shift Focus to Performing Partners vs. High-Risk States
Decisive_Point_1_Label: DecP1 – Key Partner Units Reach Reliable Operational Competence
Depends_On: If partner units are compromised or politicized, branch to redirect SFA efforts or terminate specific lines of assistance; impacts OBJ 2 interdiction and proxy disruption.

Objective_Title: Strengthen & Protect Western Hemisphere Partnership Network
OAI_Description: Expand IMET and State Partnership Program engagements, prioritizing fence-sitter and PRC/RUS-influenced nations.
Land: Send land officers/NCOs to PME focused on rule of law and civil-military norms.
Sea: Embed naval and coast guard leaders in maritime security and MDA-focused PME.
Air: Train air leaders in safety, interoperability, and HA/DR.
Cyber: Develop cyber education and CERT partnerships.
Space: Expose partners to use of space-based ISR and SSA.
Decision_Point_1_Label: DP1 – Resource & Political Limits on Seat Expansion
Decision_Point_2_Label: DP2 – Alumni Career Trajectories in Key States
Decisive_Point_1_Label: DecP1 – Cohort of Regionally Influential Alumni Emerges
Depends_On: If alumni in critical states are captured by authoritarian regimes, branch to stricter vetting or suspension; reduces long-term partner resilience near Venezuela.

Objective_Title: Strengthen & Protect Western Hemisphere Partnership Network
OAI_Description: Conduct annual multinational Hemispheric Shield exercises focused on multi-domain interdiction, DSCA, and interoperability.
Sea: Maritime interdiction vignettes including realistic lethal-force and boarding dilemmas.
Air: Air C2, ISR, and DSCA airlift/evacuation practice.
Cyber: Cyber incident response injecting TCO and state-actor threats.
Space: Use space-enabled COP as backbone for exercise.
Decision_Point_1_Label: DP1 – Partner Sensitivity to Venezuela-Focused Scenarios
Decision_Point_2_Label: DP2 – Exercise Complexity vs. Political Risk Balance
Decisive_Point_1_Label: DecP1 – First Full Multi-Domain Hemispheric Shield Executed
Decisive_Point_2_Label: DecP2 – Exercise Demonstrates Credible Hemispheric Response to Venezuela Contingencies
Depends_On: If partners push back on Venezuela-centric vignettes, branch to more generic scenarios and handle Venezuela-specific rehearsals via classified/limited venues.

Objective_Title: Strengthen & Protect Western Hemisphere Partnership Network
OAI_Description: Integrate Canadian and Mexican militaries into JTF-HD planning, sensor fusion, and response for homeland defense.
Land: Develop and rehearse land HD and DSCA roles.
Sea: Define maritime contributions in Gulf/Caribbean and Arctic approaches.
Air: Align air defense, NORAD coordination, and alert postures.
Cyber: Coordinate HD-relevant cyber defense and incident response.
Space: Fuse shared space-based early warning and missile defense data.
Decision_Point_1_Label: DP1 – Mexican/Canadian Appetite for Deeper HD Role
Decision_Point_2_Label: DP2 – Caveats on Activities Near Venezuela
Decisive_Point_1_Label: DecP1 – Coherent Tri-National HD CONOPS Exercised
Depends_On: If Mexican or Canadian caveats on Venezuela-related HD activities are strong, branch to differentiated roles and more unilateral U.S. posture around Caribbean/Venezuela.

Objective_Title: Strengthen & Protect Western Hemisphere Partnership Network
OAI_Description: Deploy and operate early-warning sensors (radar, aerostats, OTH) to cover approaches to North America.
Land: Land sites for support facilities and integration with national networks.
Sea: Maritime radars and sensors covering Caribbean and approaches used by Venezuela-linked flows.
Air: Air surveillance radars and cueing for NORAD and partners.
Cyber: Secure networks and cross-domain solutions for warning data.
Space: Integration of space-based missile warning and surveillance.
Decision_Point_1_Label: DP1 – Site Access and Environmental Approval
Decision_Point_2_Label: DP2 – Budget and Tech Risk Accepted
Decisive_Point_1_Label: DecP1 – Initial Coverage of Gulf/Caribbean Achieved
Decisive_Point_2_Label: DecP2 – Integrated Warning Grid for Hemisphere
Depends_On: If key sites near politically sensitive areas are blocked, branch to alternative siting and heavier reliance on space/commercial sensors.

Objective_Title: Strengthen & Protect Western Hemisphere Partnership Network
IMO_Title: Preserve Maritime Interdiction & Border Security Capacity
OAI_Description: Sustain and refine joint and combined maritime interdiction ops (building on Op CARIBBE and current boat strikes).
Land: Land staging bases and law-enforcement integration.
Sea: USCG/USN/partner interdiction patterns in Caribbean and off Venezuela.
Air: MPA, P-8, and other air ISR supporting at-sea interdiction.
Cyber: Cyber defense of maritime C2 and logistics networks.
Space: Use of space AIS, SAR, and imagery to cue interdiction.
Decision_Point_1_Label: DP1 – Lethal Boat Strike Authorities Politically Sustainable or Not
Decision_Point_2_Label: DP2 – Partner ROE Alignment and Legal Risk
Decision_Point_3_Label: DP3 – Assessment of Strategic Signalling to Venezuela
Decisive_Point_1_Label: DecP1 – Persistent MDA and Interdiction in Key Chokepoints
Decisive_Point_2_Label: DecP2 – Demonstrated Ability To Strangle High-Value Flows When Directed
Depends_On: If growing domestic/partner concerns mirror current UK/Colombia intel withholding, branch to reduced kinetic focus and increased reliance on financial/cyber disruption and law enforcement.

Objective_Title: Strengthen & Protect Western Hemisphere Partnership Network
IMO_Title: Preserve Maritime Interdiction & Border Security Capacity
OAI_Description: Provide ISR and planning support to DHS/CBP targeting TCOs and flows linked to Venezuela.
Land: Ground ISR and analytic support along key corridors.
Sea: Support coastal and near-shore interdiction that feeds land border pressure.
Air: Air ISR and movement tracking near border regions.
Cyber: Cyber analytics and TCO network mapping for DHS/CBP.
Space: Use of space imagery and change detection for border situational awareness.
Decision_Point_1_Label: DP1 – DHS/CBP Demand vs. WHEMCOM Bandwidth
Decision_Point_2_Label: DP2 – Domestic Political Concerns over Militarization
Decisive_Point_1_Label: DecP1 – Shared Border Threat Picture Institutionalized
Depends_On: If political pressure rises against military involvement, branch to analytic-only support and de-emphasize uniformed presence at the tactical edge.

Objective_Title: Strengthen & Protect Western Hemisphere Partnership Network
IMO_Title: Ensure DSCA Responsiveness During Venezuela-Driven Instability
OAI_Description: Pre-position HA/DR stocks in selected partner nations to respond to Venezuela-driven crises and regional shocks.
Land: Land depots and secure storage facilities.
Sea: Use of key ports and sea lines for HA/DR movement.
Air: Airfields identified for airlift and evacuation.
Cyber: Resilient DSCA communications and coordination tools.
Space: Use of space imagery for disaster assessment and routing.
Decision_Point_1_Label: DP1 – Partner Willingness To Host Stocks Without Politicization
Decision_Point_2_Label: DP2 – Logistics and Security Risks Acceptable
Decisive_Point_1_Label: DecP1 – Initial Stocks in Place and Accounted For
Decisive_Point_2_Label: DecP2 – HA/DR System Successfully Used in At Least One Major Event
Depends_On: If corruption or politicization of stocks emerges, branch to more centralized U.S. custody and tighter access controls; may affect perceptions of partnership.

Objective_Title: Strengthen & Protect Western Hemisphere Partnership Network
IMO_Title: Ensure DSCA Responsiveness During Venezuela-Driven Instability
OAI_Description: Conduct recurring DSCA/FDR exercises with FEMA, USAID, and regional partners, focused on mass migration and crisis spillover from Venezuela.
Land: Land-based DSCA drills in border communities and host nations.
Sea: Maritime HA/DR and evac support including use of naval platforms.
Air: Airlift, aero-medical evacuation, and air bridge drills.
Cyber: Cyber continuity planning for DSCA partners.
Space: Integration of space-derived products into DSCA decision-making.
Decision_Point_1_Label: DP1 – Interagency Appetite for Large-Scale DSCA Rehearsals
Decision_Point_2_Label: DP2 – Partner Sensitivity to Venezuela-Specific Scenarios
Decisive_Point_1_Label: DecP1 – DSCA Plans Tested and Validated in Exercises
Decisive_Point_2_Label: DecP2 – DSCA System Performs Under Real Contingency
Depends_On: If politically sensitive Venezuela scenarios create friction, branch to generic disaster scenarios while handling Venezuela-specific planning in limited, classified venues.
